Package com.brycethuilot.auto_mailer

Class Email

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brycethuilot.auto_mailer.Email
  • public class Email
extends java.lang.Object
    Email class can be used to send emails with attachments from the address set in the config It uses office365 smtp to send mail
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Bryce Thuilot

    • Method Detail

      • sendEmail

        boolean sendEmail​(java.lang.String to,
                  java.lang.String subject,
                  java.lang.String body,
                  java.lang.String attachment,
                  java.lang.String fileName)
        Send an email to the address given with the given, subject, body attachment and attachment name
        Parameters:
        to - the address to send to
        subject - the subject of the email
        body - the body of the email
        attachment - attachment file
        fileName - the name to give to the attacment
        Returns:
        true if successfully sent, false if not

      • formatRenewalEmail

        private java.lang.String formatRenewalEmail()
        Formats the main body of a renewal email
        Returns:
        the formatted renewal email body, as a string

      • emailBody

        java.lang.String emailBody​(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String policyNumber,
                           java.lang.String company,
                           java.lang.String effectiveDate,
                           java.lang.String expirationDate,
                           boolean renewal)
        Creates and returns the email body with the given information
        Parameters:
        name - name of the insured that the email is being sent to
        policyNumber - polciy number of the policy
        company - company of the policy
        effectiveDate - effective date of the policy
        expirationDate - expiration date of the policy
        renewal - whether or not its a renewal
        Returns:
        the formatted email body, as a string

      • formatNewBusinessEmail

        private java.lang.String formatNewBusinessEmail​(java.lang.String effectiveDate,

        Formats the email body if it is a new policy
        Parameters:
        effectiveDate - effective date of the policy
        expirationDate - expiration date of the policy
        Returns:
        the formatted new policy body, as a string
